content:
Imagine you are the worlds best AI Sales Coach. I will provide you with the transcript of a sales call in multiple parts. Provide a detailed recap of each part of the sales call transcript to help the sales manager gain a complete detailed understanding of the deal. Use a sales framework. 

Transcript part 3 (10m28s-20m4s our of 29m02s):

"20m 15s Matt Brown though.
20m 15s Matt Brown So like if we wanted to deploy Wall to Wall right away that's, where we'd hook into Okta and just have everybody set up.
20m 22s Matt Brown That would mean they are a billable user.
20m 24s Matt Brown If you are doing more of a partial rollout in stages, what we would want to do is we do have more of a a manual in the sense that you could provide the the CSV list of those users.
20m 37s Matt Brown We can import that directly and have just those users be paid users while at the same time opening up access for there to be organic growth from those other teams as well.
20m 50s Matt Brown So all that to say is we do have some options which include a full wall to wall deployment right at once.
20m 57s Matt Brown Or if we do want to go organically, we would have more of like a quarterly true up system where it's like, hey, we start at 500 users.
21m 5s Matt Brown The next quarter we've bumped up to 750 and so on and so forth. So we would work with you on a quarterly basis just to get that set
21m 15s Nick Sarkesian up. So how does that true Upwork? Is it we have 500 licenses. All of them are on enterprise and then maybe we have 600 users on a free version.
21m 30s Nick Sarkesian They want to get on enterprise. We can then add them another 100 licenses like mid-quarter.
21m 36s Nick Sarkesian And then at the end of the quarter, we drew up and look at how much, how long those people will use those additional licenses, and then you charge us for it How. does that how does that operate?
21m 46s Nick Sarkesian Yeah, that's a good question. So
21m 48s Matt Brown what we would do is, first and foremost, we don't hear the the access. So we can't do say 500 enterprise 100 pro 53. It would be all or nothing from that perspective.
22m 1s Matt Brown But once we were agree agreed upon a particular rollout. So initial rollout of let's say 500, I know that number has been thrown around.
22m 9s Matt Brown We would build for those 500 users. But then what we would do is, is flat rate the plan.
22m 15s Matt Brown So that means that any additional users that wanted to be added to Fellow, you wouldn't have to come and there wouldn't be that bottleneck of having to go to your account manager or to message support before those team members.
22m 30s Matt Brown Got it. You could just add them the day of and then when that billing period comes up. So if we are doing that quarterly true up, we would go back in and see who's been active for that last period and just.
22m 44s Matt Brown Adjust accordingly.
22m 47s Nick Sarkesian So is going backwards then. So if we
22m 50s Trina Berks start 600 people use it, but then they realize they don't really care to use it And. now we only have 500. Can we go backwards?
22m 59s Trina Berks Yeah. I mean, theoretically
23m 1s Matt Brown could I think that would be certainly a missed opportunity for for both parties, though, right. Like we don't want to we don't want to overbuild something right away and then have to claw it back.
23m 11s Matt Brown I don't think that's the objective of of either side. What we would want to do is start with those users who are already committed to it right away.
23m 20s Matt Brown And, you know, I realize getting that initial initial momentum might seem a little daunting. But we do have the methodology here at Fellow.
23m 27s Matt Brown We do have the resources to help ramp that up. And then, as you've already experienced, it is pretty viral. Once you know, the team members who have it are showing it to the team members who might not.
23m 40s Matt Brown They can, especially with ACTA.
23m 42s Trina Berks So if we throw it an OCTA, then people see this new thing and like, Oh, what's this shiny new object? They click on it twice and then never
23m 48s Matt Brown touch it again. We could see a big spike, I
23m 52s Trina Berks feel like. And what we're going to do from our
23m 54s Matt Brown side is we we can certainly tell who's like an active user versus who's signed in once Trina. So we're not going to be like, oh, you know, every because we opened it up to OCTA all, all 1500 team members added it.
24m 7s Matt Brown We can go back and look and say, oh, you know what, it's actually just 500 users who are using it on a on an active basis.
24m 14s Matt Brown So we don't okay.
24m 16s Trina Berks We certainly don't want
24m 19s Matt Brown to do that. That doesn't leave a really good taste in any of our clients mouth. Okay. So just 5 minutes left.
24m 32s Matt Brown Just in terms of wrap up, what I will send over in terms of our recap packet is security compliance documentation a little bit more about our TA integration as well.
24m 42s Matt Brown Get the SOC to Mbda sent over for DocuSign signature. I will also send over the JIRA integration too.
24m 52s Matt Brown And then in terms of like initial pricing, is there like a scope or deployment that you'd like some initial pricing on first or is it all to premature to chat about that?
25m 5s Matt Brown I'm just curious, like where the next steps would look like for the team internally? I would say I know Matthew and I talked
25m 14s Eric Cameron briefly. We got like Lucas, for instance and, my team back on the system. I would say in the short term, let's activate pro
25m 23s Nick Sarkesian licenses for those I know you're holding on billing
25m 26s Eric Cameron and then because we are so kind of testing it out.
25m 29s Eric Cameron But I do want Nic and team to feel good about all the documentation that you send over before we make any enterprise level decisions 100%.
25m 39s Eric Cameron I'll also
25m 40s Matt Brown provide a little bit more overview of like our onboarding methodology as well.
25m 45s Matt Brown So once you would commit to the enterprise rollout plan and we do have a 30 day robust methodology to get everybody from that that paid license perspective up and running.
25m 58s Matt Brown Yeah. Thank you. That's good.
25m 59s Eric Cameron Yeah. Probably just from a. Timing perspective just so you have some awareness. We probably wouldn't look to fully kick this off at an enterprise level until the beginning of next year.
26m 16s Matt Brown Sanders just. In the meantime, though, I think this is where we can really begin to build that momentum.
26m 24s Matt Brown One out of all of the the already converted advocates of Fellow and then to being able to to collaborate with those team members who might not have seen it yet.
26m 35s Matt Brown We can do that.
26m 37s Eric Cameron Just lastly Eric,, sorry. Just
26m 40s Matt Brown so to to shore up on billing because I know I had paused it. So we do have active for the past month we do have 20 users already going back.
26m 54s Matt Brown So what I can do is just flip that over to our pro annual rate and then additional users depending on how you want to configure your your workspace settings can either be invited by other current paid users or alternatively we can restrict it.
27m 11s Matt Brown So they have to come in through whether it's you or Nick, Trina or Coop or any of the other admins like which. How would you prefer in terms of workspace configuration?
27m 23s Matt Brown Uh, next.
27m 25s Eric Cameron Who would you rather that come in?
27m 26s Eric Cameron It's fine to come in through me, but if you wanted to come in through your team, that's totally probably makes more sense over the long term.
27m 34s Eric Cameron Yeah, we can do that.
27m 36s Nick Sarkesian So, Nick. Katrina which,
27m 38s Eric Cameron view makes sense?
27m 43s Nick Sarkesian Yeah. Both. Just in case one
27m 47s Eric Cameron of us is. Yeah. I'll take a little time
27m 51s Nick Sarkesian off or something, right? Yeah, no problem. We can do that.
27m 54s Matt Brown I know Tyler and Alex are the only two admins at this point in time, so I can make the three of you admins as well.
28m 2s Matt Brown And then so my recommendation would be to keep that open only because that's going to encourage that organic growth, at least in the short term, be able to build that momentum.
28m 13s Matt Brown So come next month or the month after, as we get a better estimate of what that first enterprise deployment stage would look like, we have a more accurate
28m 24s Eric Cameron picture. Sounds good. Could you? Would you be able to remove Tyler and Alex's admins and just add me, Nick and Trina as admins?
28m 34s Eric Cameron Absolutely. I know
28m 35s Matt Brown Alex is fine with that. Him and I talked about that, so
28m 38s Eric Cameron he's fine to be removed. Yeah. Not a problem So.
28m 42s Matt Brown I will. I will get that ball rolling as well. And I'll send you an email confirmation after the recap, just to let you know that's been completed.
28m 52s Matt Brown Sounds great. Anybody
28m 53s Eric Cameron else have any other questions or are we good? No, I'm good here. Okay.
29m 0s Nick Sarkesian All right. Thanks. I appreciate it. Thanks so
29m 2s Eric Cameron much. Have a great day. Bye. Feel."
